summary: Admin Users 'Show Deleted' toggle feature verified successfully. All 8 backend API tests passed (100%) and all 6 frontend UI tests passed (100%). The toggle correctly filters users based on is_deleted status and calls the API with include_deleted query parameter.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/admin/users (without include_deleted) returns only non-deleted users (1 user)
Backend: GET /api/admin/users?include_deleted=true returns ALL users including soft-deleted (29 users total)
Backend: include_deleted=false behaves same as default (no parameter)
Backend: User count difference confirms toggle works (1 vs 29 users)
Backend: Deleted users have proper is_deleted=true field
Backend: User response includes summary data (total_orders, cart_items)
Frontend: Admin Users page has 'Show deleted' toggle checkbox (data-testid='show-deleted-toggle')
Frontend: Toggle is unchecked by default - shows only 1 non-deleted user
Frontend: No DELETED badges visible when toggle is unchecked
Frontend: When toggle is checked, shows 29 users with 28 DELETED badges (data-testid='badge-deleted')
Frontend: User count text updates from '1 registered user(s)' to '29 registered user(s)' when toggle is ON
Frontend: Toggling back to unchecked hides deleted users (returns to 1 user, 0 DELETED badges)
seed_data_creation: None - used existing test data (1 non-deleted user, 28 deleted test users)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Admin Users 'Show Deleted' toggle feature is fully functional. The toggle at /admin/users page (data-testid='show-deleted-toggle') correctly calls GET /api/admin/users with ?include_deleted=true when checked. Deleted users display with red 'DELETED' badge (data-testid='badge-deleted'). Current test data has 1 real user (Tracy) and 28 soft-deleted test users.
